page.title: 05PORT OF MENTEITH INCHMAHOME
page.content: It is thought that the masons employed at Inchmahome came from the building of the Cathedral Kirk of Dunblane. The earliest buildings date from the mid thirteenth century. For the past five years there has been a group of workmen repairing the ruins to make them safe for visitors and to prevent further decay. About 3000 people visit the island each year. { Mary Queen of Scots}was brought to the island for safety in 1544 when {Henry VIII}attacked and burned Edinburgh and surrounding districts towards Stirling. Mary was taken secretly from Inchmahome and sent to France a few weeks later.
